Posts.Content: Hi, You are so not moaning and even if you were this is the best place to do it. I had 6 fec, finished in March last year, I to starting losing my hair on day 15, I shaved it all off about a week later because i couldn't stand all the mess ( i'm a bit of a clean freak.) I wasn't completely bold until well after fec number 2 and after number 3 it started to grow back, it was just fine and fluffy but it was hair. After it falls out it's just another step in the whole process, just tick it off and get yourself to the end, i found losing my eyebrows and eyelashes much more upsetting as i just looked so different but the body hair going is great. Take care, love Char xxx
Posts.Title: Hair falling out.

Posts.Content: Hi Sally, You could be right in thinking the frozen peas on your head will help because i did a similar thing i used to run tea towels under very cold water and then sit with them on my head and the relief was brilliant and much more effective than any pain killer even if you do look a little silly.The pain will stop as soon as all your hair has gone, losing your hair is crap but just see it as another step over and closer to the end of your treatment, Take care, love Char xxx
Posts.Title: Painful scalp- hair falling out- any tips on pain relief?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, I don,t know what to say i didn,t think anyone would write to me but I,m very grateful you did, they didn,t give me anything to protect my ovaries because i was 40 at the time and have finished my family, i had always had regular periods so like you say because the flushes have stopped, it would make sense that perhaps things are trying to work, i go back to see my docter next tuesday and as things haven,t changed i,m sure she will arrange more tests and thats what i,m afraid of, i just want everything to go back to normal and no more tests and the worry that comes with it but i,m sure you as well know all about that anyway i,m off to do the rainbow charity walk in Tetbury tonight, its to raise money for another mobile chemotherepy unit so take care and thank you again. Love Char xxxx
Posts.Title: menapause or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Tess, Thank you, I can only wait and see but like you said the chances of another cancer so close has got to be low and i hadn,t given it a thought about the chemo blasting anything tricky so thats put my mind at rest a little bit, thank you very much and hope your well. Love Char x
Posts.Title: menapause or not?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I have always read posts since being diagnosed with triple negative breast cancer exactly a year ago today, i had a lumpectomy, 6 fec and 15 radio, I am not doing very well at the moment emotionally and you all seem to help one another so thought i,d give this ago. My periods stopped after the third fec and by number five i was having really bad flushes at my 6 weeks end of treatment check was told because of my age (40) that this was now probably the menapause and that was that but at the beginning of August my flushes which were really bad (20-30 aday) just stopped all of a sudden, i also had some low stomach ache and thought oh my periods must just be coming back, since then nothing other than a bit of spotting but still no flushes, i went to doc,s just over a week ago and she examined me and said everything looked healthy, took a blood test for hormone levels and told me to keep a two week diary for the spotting and come back for blood results during app the words specialist, biopsy, last smear test etc and i,m just now worried sick i,m not sure i can cope with all this again and surely i can,t be unlucky eghough to have another cancer so soon after this one, unless there thinking secondaries but i didn,t think you got secondaries there, i just thought i was getting my periods back, if anyone can shed some light on this or help in any way i would be so grateful. Love to you all, Char x
Posts.Title: menapause or not?

Posts.Content: Hi, I have had two routine mammo's and both of them have used the term 'satisfactory', on the first one i also rang my BCN to explain this and she also said it was commonly used, like you i'm am never quite sure with the wording, it seems to me they don't ever like to use the word 'clear' which for us would be nice to see once in a while. xx
Posts.Title: "Satisfactory" - whatever that means!

Posts.Content: Hi Alison, I was diagnosed with TNBC i Sep 2009, stage 2, grade 3, no nodes. I had 6 cycles of fec chemo and 15 sessions of radio. I only had the sentinal node removed so i am afraid i can't help with the exercises you need to be doing but hopefully other ladies on here will. I do have experience with bad reaction to the steroids, on my first chemo i had the usual dose with the chemo and the little white tablets to take for the next three days at home by the sat night i was practically climbing the walls, i was having irrational thoughts and excrutiating pain in my neck and shoulders where i could not relax eventually in the early hours i had a severe anxiety attack and was taken into hospital, they ran some tests and deceided i was having steroid physcosis which can sometimes happen. On the remainder of my chemo's i had a reduced amount of steroids with the chemo and no tablets at home and to help with the sickness i had the drug emend which is one tablet before chemo and one tablet for the next two days, which helped i did have further panic attacks and problems with my neck and shoulders but it was much more manageable. The steroids are given to help with allergic reactions aswell as reducing sickness but as you have had two chemosÂ  they may say it would be ok, the steroids also help with inflammation so they gave me omeprazole for this also. I hope this helps a little bit and things are easier next time. Lots of love Char. xxxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi Helen, Since my treatment ended in May last year it took a good few months to regain my strength but now 10 months on i am feeling pretty much back to normal, i have had a couple of scares but thankfully both have been ok, I'm sorry i can't help you with your type of chemo but hopefully someone will come along who knows a bit more. As you know because we are not receptive to hormones our treatment is a bit limited and when the chemo and radio is done that's pretty much it, for me i have a meeting once a year with my consultant and then one with my oncologist and a yearly mammogram but because of my two scares i haven't had much time away from it really, i'm hoping now i will get a bit of a reprieve and try and get back to normality. Do you have access to a breast care nurse where you are? i find mine invaluable. Take care, love Char xxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Sorry last post was supposed to be To Alison. Char xxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi Alison, Its a shame you don't have a breast cancer nurse but i am sure you will get lots of help and advice from macmillan when you ring them. To have to translate your own notes on the computer is amazing, i am hopeless at things like that and take my husband every time we have an appointment as i never remember to ask what i am supposed to so well done you. I to am nervous about the future with TNBC but hopefully one day soon they will find something else to help ladies like us. Good luck phoning macmillan, let me know how you get on. Lots of love, Char xxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi Allison, Well done for getting another chemo over and done with, counting them done is a good way of mentally marking them off. Glad to hear you managed to see the English speaking nurse, as long as you are coping with the sickness the lack of steroids will be a bonus ( they made me totally nuts). Be careful with other online sites, i now only use this one and there is another one "breast cancer care", in the beginning it's quite tempting to keep looking at lots of different information, put all your energy into your treatment it will help you so much more. I only live about an hours drive away from Cardiff, so who knows we could be doing our xmas shopping togeather at the end of the year. Take care of yourself, Lots of love Char xxxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, If you have a hormone receptive breast cancer then yes vagifem is probably not a good idea for you but for triple negative breast cancer it is considered safe to use, the tiny dose of estrogen from vagifem is only absorbed locally which is great for the dryness but does nothing to alleviate any of the other symptoms. Love Char xx
Posts.Title: Tried to have intercourse, sooo painful

Posts.Content: Hello, Your situation; triple negative,SLNB, 6 FEC and radiotherapy is exactly the same as mine although mine was in Sep 09. I too had exactly the same problem when the flushing kicked in, i left it a very long and just assumed i had to put up with it, when it got so bad i could hardly sit down so i went to my gp who told me offÂ  for not seeing her sooner, because i was triple negative she said it was perfectly safe to use a vaginal suppository called vagifem which you have one a night for two weeks and then just twice a week there after, i was a bit dubious so did speak to my BCN beforehand and she said my consultant was quite happy for me to use it, it is a locally applied form of estrogen and so is safe for triple negatives to use and i have to say for quality of life and being able to enjoy a sex life again it is wonderful and for me the right choice, to be menapausel at 40 is no fun, the flushing is still horrendous so being able to alleviate one of the syptoms has helped it be a little more bearable. Don't suffer in silence like i did see your GP or speak to your BCN. Take care, lots of love, Char xxx
Posts.Title: Tried to have intercourse, sooo painful

Posts.Content: Hello Annabel,Â  I just wanted to say that i am so glad you are ok, i don't come on here quite so often now as i was diagnosed in Sep 09 but i have been following your posts and i to was more settled once i knew what the plan of action was going to be, treatment is tough but you will do it, stay strong and take care. Love Char xx
Posts.Title: not toooo bad today

Posts.Content: Hi all, After finishing chemo in March last year i was thrown into the wonderful world of the menapause, the flushing stopped for a few weeks last Sep and i had some spotting but by Oct the flushing then returned and no more spotting, i was told that it is common for your body to try and start working again after chemo, then in March this year the flushing stopped again and my breasts started hurting and this time 15 months without a proper period i came on, it was a completely normal period and i felt brilliant, no more brain fog, sleeping through the night and best of all no more vagifem, i went on to have period number 2 and 3 but a few weeks ago i noticed the flushing return and all the other horrible syptoms and no more periods, i am gutted as i feel so much better when my cycles returned, is it common to sway from one to the other, my hormones are all over the place and should i mention all this to my breast care nurse, i am not on any additional meds as my breast cancer was triple negative. Any advice would be great. Love Char xx
Posts.Title: menopause/periods

Posts.Content: Hi Jules, I was 40 when i went through chemo and was told then that i was on the 'cusp' meaning they may or may not come back but i really just thought it would be one or the other and not all this messing about, it was lovely to have my cycle back for a few months i felt so much better but now i am back to having flushes as well as all the other delightful things associated with the menapause. I do go for my annual check with my oncologist in June so will mention whats happening then but i don't hold out much hope in him telling me whats going to happen one way or another. Hope you are well, many thanks love Char xxxx
Posts.Title: menopause/periods

Posts.Content: Hi, Sorry to hear like me you seem to be going from one thing to the other. While for me it's here we go again i think as last week the flushing has slowed down and since yesterday i have had none so it looks like again i will be having periods again but for how long who knows. I did mention all this to my consultant and she just said it could be like this for quite a while, she did mention though that if i was having flushing at any one time and bleeding then to mention this to her as this shouldn't happen. Fingers crossed my cycle will come again and hopefully for keeps would be nice, i'm driving myself and my husband nuts with the hormones swaying from one thing to another. Love Char xx
Posts.Title: menopause/periods
